greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binomial(2n, n) - 2 mod n^4.
comment: For e > 3, unlike the cases e=1,2,3, the numbers binomial(2n, n) - 2 mod n^e are not necessarily 0 for any n>1, be it prime or composite (see A246130 for introductory comments). Testing up to n=278000, the only number n>1 for which a(n)=0 is the first Wolstenholme prime 16843 (A088164), but no composite.
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
R. J. McIntosh, On the converse of Wolstenholme's theorem, Acta Arithmetica 71 (4): 381-389, (1995)
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Aug 16 2014
